summary_points: 1. Gen Digital Inc. completed its previously announced merger with MoneyLion Inc. on April 17, 2025, with MoneyLion becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary.
2.  Each share of MoneyLion Class A common stock was converted into $82.00 in cash and one contingent value right (CVR) issued by Gen Digital.

3. Gen Digital incurred $750 million in Incremental Term B Loans, maturing on April 16, 2032, to partially fund the MoneyLion merger; these loans have an interest rate of either Bank of America’s base rate plus 0.75% or SOFR plus 1.75%, with a prepayment premium of 1.00% before the six-month anniversary of the closing date.
1. Global Payments announced preliminary first-quarter 2025 results on April 17, 2025, reporting adjusted net revenue of $2,205 million and adjusted EPS of $2.69.

2. Global Payments agreed to sell its Issuer Solutions business for $13.5 billion and acquire Worldpay for $22.7 billion (total value $24.25 billion), with both transactions expected to close in the first half of 2026.

3.  The combined transactions are projected to generate $600 million in annual run-rate cost synergies and at least $200 million in revenue synergies over three years, resulting in modest EPS accretion in the first year post-closure.
1. FIS acquired Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions business for $12 billion while concurrently selling its Worldpay stake for $6.6 billion, transactions expected to close in the first half of 2026.
2.  FIS's Q1 2025 adjusted revenue growth was 4%, while full-year 2025 adjusted revenue growth is projected to be 6%.
3. The Issuer Solutions acquisition is projected to generate over $150 million in *annual* net EBITDA synergies by the first half of 2029.

1. General Mills sold €750,000,000 of 3.600% Notes due 2032 on April 17, 2025,  through an underwriting agreement with Deutsche Bank AG, Merrill Lynch International, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc, and other underwriters.
2. The sale of the notes is expected to close on April 17, 2025, subject to customary closing conditions.
3.  The filing includes the underwriting agreement, an officers' certificate, and a legal opinion on the notes' validity.
1. Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. reported 9% GAAP revenue growth and 4% underlying revenue growth for the first quarter ended March 31, 2025.
2.  Adjusted EPS increased by 5% year-over-year to $3.06 in Q1 2025,  a figure impacted by a 10-cent per share benefit from favorable discrete tax items and a 5-cent headwind from foreign exchange.

3.  Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. identified several future risks, including the impact of geopolitical and macroeconomic conditions, cybersecurity attacks, and the financial impact of regulatory compliance.
1. American Express reported first-quarter 2025 net income of $2.6 billion, or $3.64 per share, a 6% and 9% increase year-over-year, respectively.
2.  First-quarter 2025 total revenues net of interest expense were $17.0 billion, a 7% year-over-year increase (8% on an FX-adjusted basis).

3. American Express maintained its full-year 2025 revenue growth guidance of 8 to 10 percent and EPS guidance of $15.00 to $15.50, as of April 17, 2025, but cautioned that these projections are subject to macroeconomic conditions.

1. Blackstone Inc. reported $1.2 billion in GAAP Net Income for the first quarter of 2025, and $615 million in GAAP Net Income Attributable to Blackstone Inc., as announced in a press release on April 17, 2025.
2. Year-over-year, Blackstone Inc.'s total assets under management increased by 10% to $1,167.5 billion, while fee-earning AUM increased by 10% to $860.1 billion.
3.  Blackstone has $177.2 billion in dry powder available for investment as of the end of the first quarter 2025.
1. Snap-on Inc.'s Q1 2025 net sales decreased by 3.5% year-over-year to $1,141.1 million, primarily due to a 2.3% organic decline and unfavorable currency translation.
2.  Despite the sales decrease, Snap-on Inc. achieved a higher overall gross margin of 50.7% in Q1 2025, a 20 basis point improvement compared to Q1 2024.
3.  Snap-on Inc. projects approximately $100 million in capital expenditures for 2025, with $22.9 million already spent in Q1 2025.

1. As of March 31, 2025, Principal Financial Group had $717.9 billion in assets under management, with $555.8 billion managed by Principal Asset Management - Investment Management and $133.5 billion managed by Principal Asset Management - International Pension.

2.  Foreign currency translation, market performance, and other items resulted in a 1.4% positive impact on Principal Financial Group's assets under management during the quarter ended March 31, 2025.
3.  Principal Financial Group will post its financial supplement for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, to its investor relations website on or about April 24, 2025.

1. UnitedHealth Group revised its 2025 earnings outlook (as of April 17, 2025) downward to $24.65 to $25.15 per share (net earnings) and $26 to $26.50 per share (adjusted earnings), primarily due to heightened Medicare Advantage care activity and unanticipated Optum Health member profile changes.
2. First-quarter 2025 revenues increased by $9.8 billion year-over-year to $109.6 billion,  driven by increased services provided across the enterprise.
3. Optum Health anticipates serving 650,000 new value-based care patients in 2025, despite facing greater-than-expected impacts from Medicare funding reductions.
1. News Corp's stock repurchase program, authorized for up to $1 billion, had repurchased approximately US$662,096,284.72 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 16, 2025.
2. On April 16, 2025, 21,564,513 Class A shares and 10,642,933 Class B shares were repurchased under the program, at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3. The company intends to continue repurchasing its Class A and B common stock from time to time, subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. EQT Corporation's wholly-owned subsidiary, EQM Midstream Partners, LP, redeemed 100% of its outstanding 5.500% Senior Notes due 2028 on May 1, 2025, totaling $73,456,000.
2. This redemption occurred on April 16, 2025.
3.  The filing does not specify future impacts or risks associated with this redemption.
1. On April 16, 2025, Costco Wholesale Corp announced a quarterly cash dividend increase from $1.16 to $1.30 per share, annualizing to $5.20.
2.  As of April 16, 2025, Costco operates 904 warehouses globally and e-commerce sites in several countries.

3. The SEC filing mentions several forward-looking risks, including economic conditions, competition, consumer spending, and geopolitical factors, but provides no specific numerical impact predictions.
1. MGM China Holdings Limited, a majority-owned subsidiary of MGM Resorts International, secured a HK$23.4 billion revolving credit facility on April 15, 2025, maturing 60 months later.
2.  This new facility will refinance MGM China's existing senior unsecured credit facilities,  with repayment scheduled to begin April 22, 2025.

3.  The credit facility contains covenants requiring MGM China to maintain a maximum consolidated total leverage ratio and a minimum interest coverage ratio; failure to comply, or MGM Resorts International ceasing to own more than 50% of MGM China, would trigger full prepayment.

1. CenterPoint Energy Inc.'s annual shareholder meeting on April 16, 2025, resulted in the election of ten directors to one-year terms expiring in 2026, with varying vote totals ranging from 546,518,804 to 573,104,889 "For" votes.

2.  The advisory vote on executive compensation at CenterPoint Energy Inc.'s April 16, 2025, shareholder meeting received 550,993,748 votes in favor, 22,347,963 votes against, and 1,498,014 abstentions.
3. An amendment to CenterPoint Energy Inc.'s Stock Plan for Outside Directors, approved at the April 16, 2025 shareholder meeting, increased the number of shares reserved for issuance by 350,000.
1. United Airlines Holdings, Inc. swung from a $124 million net loss in Q1 2024 to a $387 million net income in Q1 2025.
2.  United Airlines generated approximately $1 billion in ancillary fees in Q1 2025.
3.  Following the Mesa Air Group and Republic Airways merger (completed April 4th, 2025), United will receive up to 6% equity in the combined entity.
1. Diamondback Energy, Inc. repurchased 3,656,044 shares of common stock in Q1 2025 for $575 million and a further 1,560,200 shares in Q2 2025 for $200 million (both figures exclude excise tax).
2.  As of April 16, 2025, Diamondback Energy, Inc. had approximately 293 million shares outstanding.
3. Diamondback Energy, Inc. is reviewing its 2025 operating plan due to market volatility and may reduce activity if low commodity prices persist.
1. CSX Corporation's Q1 2025 revenue decreased by 7% year-over-year to $3.423 billion.
2.  CSX repurchased significantly more shares in Q1 2025 (24 million) than in Q1 2024 (7 million), despite a lower average share price.
3. As of March 31, 2025, CSX faces potential legal losses ranging from $3 million to $61 million due to an ongoing SEC investigation into its accounting restatement.
1. CSX Corporation's Q1 2025 operating income decreased 22% year-over-year to $1.04 billion, and total revenue decreased 7% year-over-year to $3.42 billion.
2.  Network constraints, costing $25 million in Q1 2025, are expected to negatively impact operations for the remainder of 2025, but with no quantified estimate of further costs.
3.  Increased fuel costs of approximately $75 million year-over-year in Q1 2025 contributed to a 200 basis point increase in the operating ratio to 68%.
